name: TheAtlantic
text: "Understanding why the Chinese Communist Party is acting in such a seemingly self-defeating fashion is now a top question on foreign-policy minds. But perhaps there’s no single right answer," @RHFontaine writes: https://t.co/1CRivtr4F3

name: TheAtlantic
text: Former President Barack Obama spoke during the funeral of Representative John Lewis. Here are his full remarks, from @realcpaz: https://t.co/GWQh3XpHQW

name: TheAtlantic
text: NASA's most sophisticated Mars rover yet has left Earth. Its mission is to find long-dead microbes in the rust-colored soil and package them up to send back home, @marinakoren reports: https://t.co/KMupzhbm3u

name: TheAtlantic
text: Donning masks, congressional lawmakers interrogated big-tech CEOs over videoconference. But all business is tech business now, and the pandemic has only increased technology’s power, writes @ibogost. https://t.co/8GMxu0h0Ps

name: TheAtlantic
text: The NBA’s insulated bubble in Florida recalls the ancient Olympic Games, ratcheting up the symbolism of athletic performance on a stage set apart from society. @dannychau on the league’s uneasy return: https://t.co/RrmZ6tvkZI

name: TheAtlantic
text: We have no idea what the social web could have looked like if one superpower hadn’t made it all look the same. Facebook's wacky new Geocities-inspired app just makes that clear, @kait_tiffany reports. https://t.co/E74G0g8fKh

name: TheAtlantic
text: At Rep. John Lewis's funeral service, former President Barack Obama said Lewis will be a "founding father of that fuller, fairer, better America." Adam Serwer writes that without activists like Lewis, the U.S. would not have been free for all its citizens. https://t.co/9DU3SvUOiL

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @AdrienneLaF: “COVID-19 has reawakened America’s spirit of misdirected anxiety, inspiring... risk-reduction rituals that make us feel safer but don’t actually do much to reduce risk—even as more dangerous activities are still allowed.” https://t.co/Iqu6x284D4

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @NickBaumann: Read @AdamHSays on the CBC and defunding the police: https://t.co/KkFHFy18uR

name: TheAtlantic
text: "You have met Facts Man before if you have spent any time online in the past half decade or so. He’s inescapable. He podcasts. He makes YouTube videos. He traffics in Medium posts," @AnnieLowrey writes: https://t.co/0uSNs5QLDX

name: TheAtlantic
text: 2020 may offer Democrats their best chance yet to take back state legislatures across the country, just in time for redistricting to begin in 2021, @RonBrownstein writes: https://t.co/U7znLUPSCE

name: TheAtlantic
text: "We have fully embraced our collective dedication to the boundary. As I drive around, I am amused by the painted bear statues that now all exhibit handmade cloth masks," Annette Saunooke Clapsaddle writes: https://t.co/eBPzwSoyVv

name: TheAtlantic
text: Photos of the Week: Stari Most, Flaming Jet, Hug Kit—via @TheAtlPhoto: https://t.co/kZ2QxLQxbL

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @TheAtlPhoto: Photos of the Week: Stari Most, Flaming Jet, Hug Kit - 35 images from the past seven days, including a high-rise fire in Turkey, Snow White donating blood, open-air opera in Greece, and much more. https://t.co/ikM5yaeFpb https://t.co/uQ0NnIkPjc

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @julieebeck: it’s been a bit baffling to me when people talk as though fully reopening schools is the only thing we could do to help working parents. But as @AshleyFetters reported, there ARE other options—they just require more time, money, and creativity

https://t.co/qKfu3lFpf8

name: TheAtlantic
text: Television and film have reached Peak Cop. Noir fiction offers an alternative, writes @clickclaimprize. https://t.co/YrVq9Lz6SG

name: TheAtlantic
text: Can the Congressional Black Caucus lead during the national reckoning on racism? @AdamHSays reports https://t.co/bbI7cXEGHz
